result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Robert Myers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Design.Drugs(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Must obtain/maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathan Robert Myers in court with attorney Chad Allen Lanning.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lanning provides paperwork to Court.  Court reviews charge/penalty with Defendant.  DE pleads Guilty to Count 1.  Break for Atty. Lanning to review PQWOR with Defendant.  
3:37 resume - Court reviews PQWOR with defendant.  Court advises that he cannot possess firearm.  Court finds plea made FVI, finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds guilty of count 1.  Count 2 and uncharged count are DRI.  Atty. Sempf is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Lanning is heard.  Mr. Myers makes statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

Sentence withheld, 
Probation for 3 years with conditions:
Absolute sobriety,
Any counseling recommended by agent,
Costs/fees.
Maintain full time employment or full time education, or combination of two,
DNA sample.

Discussion on 15CV297, Atty. Lanning states they have no interest in that case, agrees to default judgment on that case.  Court enters default judgment on that case.

Defendant Nathan Robert Myers in court, in custody with attorney Chad Allen Lanning.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nathan Robert Myers in court with attorney Chad Allen Lanning.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Sgt. Joseph Nicholas, sworn & testifies; witness ID's defendant; Parties heard; Court finds prob cause;  Arraignment scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Greg E. Vollan appeared. Parties heard on new counsel and continuance; Court signed continuance and releases Atty Vollan and allows for new attorney Chad Lanning
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant Nathan Robert Myers w/Atty Greg Vollan (SPD eligible) appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $2500 bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Nathan Robert Myers w/Atty Greg Vollan (SPD eligible) appeared by video means. Prosecuting Law Intern Kevin Schmidt w/Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000.00 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
